intro: Brachystegia katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the Central African rainforests. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The tree typically grows to a height of 15-25 meters, with a broad, spreading canopy. Its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of numerous small, oval-shaped leaflets. The flowers are small and yellowish-green, arranged in terminal racemes, contributing to its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
